summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Maxwell, transmitting supplemental production of 3500 material, discovery, and non-testifying witness material. It includes cover letters and indexes, with a copy sent to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (likely defense counsel) of the email regarding supplemental production in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case 'US v. Maxwell'. A copy of the supplemental production was sent to her at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, transmitting supplemental legal materials to the defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

connections.description: Prosecutor for the United States government in the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Laura Menninger is listed as defense counsel receiving materials on behalf of the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.
Prosecutor communicating with and providing supplemental discovery materials to defense counsel in an ongoing case.

events.title: Supplemental Production in US v. Maxwell
events.description: The prosecution transmits supplemental 3500 material, discovery, and non-testifying witness material to the defense in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On November 24, 2021, the prosecution in US v. Maxwell provided a supplemental production of 3500 material, discovery, and non-testifying witness material to the defense.
The materials were sent via USAfx to defense counsel, and a copy was sent via FedEx to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center).
The communication originated from an Assistant United States Attorney at the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing pre-trial evidence disclosure.
The email attachments include indexes and cover letters for the supplemental production, which are standard in federal criminal procedure.
